TWY P4 BTN TWY M AND TWY R CONSTRUCTION PHASE 2 ACTIVE. REF AIP SUP IFR 04/24 22 FEB 2024. *********************LIDO RMK************************** CONSTRUCTION PHASE 2 (BA2): AUG 2024 - APR 2025 DURING THE BA2 PHASE, TWY P4 WILL BE CLOSED BETWEEN TWY M AND TWY R.STANDS B05, B06, B07, B08 AND V61A WILL REMAIN CLOSED DURING THE BA2 PHASE.STAND B04 WILL BE REDUCED TO CODE LETTER C AIRCRAFT AND WILL BE ADJUSTED. STAND B03 WILL BE ADJUSTED IN ITS LAYOUT. STAND B09 WILL BE ADJUSTED TO BE AVAILABLE TO CODE LETTER E AIRCRAFT AGAIN.STANDS V61, V62 AND V63 WILL REMAIN PUSH-BACK POSITIONS DURING THE BA2 PHASE.THE DE-ICING PADS IN THE WEST WILL HAVE TO BE ADJUSTED AS FOLLOWS: - PAD 1 WILL BE DESIGNED TRANSVERSELY IN THE AREA OF STANDS V62 AND V63 FOR AIRCRAFT UP TO CODE LETTER C. (USE ALTERNATELY WITH THE OTHER PAD 1) - ACCESS TO PAD 1 WILL EXCLUSIVELY BE VIA TWY L7. - FOR THE DE-ICING OF THE A380, THE CURRENT PAD 3 (TWY R) WILL REMAIN AVAILABLE BUT WILL BE DESIGNATED AS PAD 1 DURING THE BA2 PHASE AND WILL BE USED ALTERNATELY WITH THE NEW PAD 1. - THE CURRENT PAD 4 WILL BE DESIGNATED AS PAD 2 AND WILL ONLY BE AVAILABLE TO AIRCRAFT UP TO CODE LETTER E. - PAD 3 AND PAD 4 WILL BE CREATED IN THE AREA OF STANDS V75 AND V76 FOR AIRCRAFT UP TO CODE LETTER C *****************************END OF LIDO RMK***********************

SX0013/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT EDDF/FRA/FRANKFURT/MAIN VALIDITY: 21MAR24 - 30APR25 INSTALLATION OF A RIAS AT FRANKFURT MAIN AIRPORT TO INCREASE SAFETY WHEN XNG RWY 07C/25C, A RWY INCURSION ALERTING SYSTEM (RIAS) HAS BEEN INSTL ON TWYS M6 AND M30 IN ADDN TO THE EXISTING CAT II/III HLDG PSN INCLUDING STOP BAR. THIS SYSTEM IS ACT EVEN BY THE SLIGHTEST XNG OF THE ACT STOP BAR AND ALERTS THE PILOT. FST, THE ACFT APPROACHING THE CAT II/III HLDG PSN IS DETECTED BY A MICROWAVE SENSOR SYSTEM. IN CASE OF AN UNAUTHORISED XNG OF THE ACT STOP BAR, FOUR VERY BRIGHT, FLG RED SFC LGT AT THE CAT I HLDG PSN AS WELL AS TWO RED LGT EACH ON BOTH SHOULDERS OF TWY BTN THE CAT I AND CAT II/III HLDG PSN ARE ACT. THE LGT IS DIRECTED TOWARDS THE PILOT AND THUS ALERTS THE PILOT OF AN IMMINENT RWY INCURSION. IN ADDN, THE ATC TWR CONTROLLERS ARE ALERTED

ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (DPI) MSG PROVIDED TO NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER (NMOC). 1.1. ADS-B DATA REQUIRED 1.1.1. FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND: A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A - FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK. - AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND. - WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS IDENTIFICATION (I.E. THE CALLSIGN USED IN FLIGHT), THIS MUST BE ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST. 1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4. IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS), TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

ARRIVING AIRCRAFT - IF HAS ALREADY RECEIVED TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS, CONTINUES STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE, TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND OR, IF HAS BEEN INSTRUCTED PROCEED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF THE FAILURE OCCURS IN FLIGHT OR IN ANY CASE NO TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED: - IF IT RECEIVES SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS, VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, IT CLEARS THE LANDING AREA AND WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF IT DOES NOT RECEIVE THESE INSTRUCTIONS VIA LIGHT SIGNALS (FOR EXAMPLE IN THE CASE OF REDUCED VISIBILITY) IT STOPS ON THE RUNWAY, AT THE FIRST AVAILABLE LINK, AND IN ANY CASE BASED ON ANY KNOWN RESTRICTIONS, WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. NOTE: THE INSTRUCTION TO CLEAR THE LANDING AREA, PROVIDED VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, DOES NOT IMPLY CONSTRAINTS ON THE ROUTE TO FOLLOW AND THEREFORE CAN ONLY BE USED WHEN COMPATIBLE WITH THE TRAFFIC SITUATION IN PROGRESS IN THE MANEUVERING AREA REF AIP AD 2 LIPK 1-13

WITH REFERENCE TO ITALIAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY (ENAC)PROVISION 4 JUN 2024, DUE TO REDUCED AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT PARKING STANDS FOR NOT SCHEDULED FLIGHTS, THE MANAGEMENT OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS ON ARRIVAL WILL TAKE PLACE AS FOLLOWS: 1)IN ORDER TO SAFEGUARD THE AVAILABILITY OF PARKING STANDS FOR FLIGHTS REGULARLY SCHEDULED AT THE AIRPORT, THE DIVERTED FLIGHTS, AFTER LANDING, WILL BE PARKED ON THE APRON ONLY IN THE PRESENCE OF APPROPRIATE PARKING STANDS AVAILABLE FOR AT LEAST 2 HOURS (OR EVEN LONGER DEPENDING ON CURRENT OPERATIONAL SITUATION). IN THE ABSENCE OF SUCH TIPOLOGY OF AIRCRAFT STAND, DIVERTED FLIGHTS COULD BE SUBJECT TO LONG LASTING WAIT IN THE MOVEMENT AREA (EVEN A FEW HOURS), WITHOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF DISEMBARKING PASSENGERS, BAGS AND FREIGHT 2)THE CREW OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS PARKED IN THE MOVEMENT AREA ARE REQUESTED TO CONTACT HANDLER'S VHF FREQUENCY TO COMMUNICATE ANY REDUCTION IN EXPECTED ETD FROM THE AIRPORT, IN ORDER TO ALLOW THE AERODROME OPERATOR TO RE-EVALUATE THE AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT STANDS ON THE APRON REF AIP AD 2 LIPE 1-23 ITEM 2.20 'LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS'

MENTIONED CHANGES ARE THE FLW: FREQ 131.880MHZ IS AVAILABLE H24 FOR AD OPR 'SEA' WITH CALLSIGN 'MALPENSA OPERATIONS' (PARAGRAPH 2.1.2 'CALL SIGN AND FREQ') AND SHALL BE USED BY PILOTS OF DEP ACFT, AFTER COMPLETING ALL HANDLING OPERATIONS AND CONFIRMING TOBT CONSISTENCY WITH THE RAMP AGENT, TO REPORT 'READY' SPECIFYING THE STAND AND THE FLIGHT NUMBER. MALPENSA OPERATIONS, AFTER CHECKING 'READY' STATUS, WILL ISSUE THE ARDT (ACTUAL READY TIME) AND WILL PROVIDE THE PILOT WITH THE CURRENT TSAT, THEN PILOTS SHALL REQUEST STARTUP CLEARANCE TO TWR DELIVERY OR GROUND FREQ ACCORDING TO OPR HR. FLIGHTS MUST BE 'READY TO MOVE' AT TOBT, HOWEVER, ARDT CAN BE GRANTED BY MALPENSA OPS WITHIN RANGE TOBT PLUS 5 MINUTES (PARAGRAPH 2.1.5 LIMITATIONS/REGULATIONS ON APN' POINT 'A' AND 2.2.2 'MILESTONES' POINT D 'ARDT'). TWR DELIVERY FREQ SHALL BE MONITORED BY PILOTS AFTER INSERTION OF A NEW TOBT (PARAGRAPH 2.2.2 'MILESTONES' POINT E 'ASAT AND AOBT'). FOR NON A-CDM DEP PROC - FAILURE OR SUSPENSION (PARAGRAPH 2.2.6), WHEN READY TO MOVE ACCORDING TO THE EOBT, PILOTS WILL CONTACT MALPENSA OPS, INSTEAD OF RAMP AGENT, SPECIFYING THE STAND AND THE FLIGHT NUMBER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.
